c74object.name: sdt.impact~
c74object.digest: Impact interaction between two solid objects [solids].
c74object.description:
sdt.impact~ simulates the nonlinear impact force generated by two objects colliding (e.g. a hammer hitting a resonator).
N.B. It must be used in conjuction with two solid object models (either sdt.inertial~ or sdt.modal~) forming a structure "object 1 ↔ sdt.impact~ ↔ object 2". This is achieved by specifying the two objects' IDs as creation arguments.
Impact force is computed from the relative position and velocity between the contact points of the two objects and is made up of an elastic component and a dissipative one:
* The elastic term is described by the force stiffness (parameter k) and an exponent (parameter alpha) which represents the sharpness of the hammer.
* The dissipative component is described by a dissipation factor (parameter mu).

Impact velocity of object 2 (in m/s). Also puts object 1 and 2 in contact.

outlet.description: If there are fewer outlets than pickups, some outputs will not be available. Outlets in excess will constantly output 0.

objarg.name: Unique_ID-Obj1
objarg.digest: Mandatory: Unique ID of object 1 (usually a sdt.inertial object).

objarg.name: Max-outlets

method.name: messages
method.digest: Inlet 0: Messages and attributes to the object.

method.name: signal
method.digest:
Inlet 0: External force on hammer / object 1, in N.
Inlet 1: If ≠ 0, sets hammer / object 1 velocity (in m/s) and puts them in contact.
Inlet 2: Fragment size of the hammer / object 1 [0.0, 1.0].
Inlet 3: External force on object 2, in N.
Inlet 4: If ≠ 0, sets object 2 velocity (in m/s) and puts them in contact.
Inlet 5: Fragment size of object 2 [0.0, 1.0].

attribute.name: shape
attribute.digest: Contact shape factor (1.5 for spherical objects).

attribute.name: contact0
attribute.digest: Pickup index of the contact point for object 1 (hammer).

attribute.name: contact1
attribute.digest: Pickup index of the contact point for object 2 (resonator).
